abstract: Specifies the height of an element.
overview:
## Overview

Here’s an example that shows how to set the height of an image to 376 points.

rawMarkdown: --- source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/TVML/element-shaping-height crawled: 2025-12-05T03:41:17Z --- # height **Article** Specifies the height of an element. ## Overview Here’s an example that shows how to set the height of an image to 376 points. ```xml ``` ### Values for height ### Elements that Use height - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/banner] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/button] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/heroimg] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/img] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/infolist] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/listitemlockup] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/monogram] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/ratingcard] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/relatedcontent] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/reviewcard] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/separator] - [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/stack] ## Element Sizing - **max-height**: Specifies the maximum height for an element. - **max-width**: Specifies the maximum width for an element. - **min-height**: Specifies the minimum height for an element. - **min-width**: Specifies the minimum width for an element. - **width**: Specifies how wide an element is.
